definitions: in an angry, hurt, or resentful way

examples.text: passengers complained bitterly about grand promises made by the company
the two governments quarreled bitterly over the terms of the loan

shortDefinitions: in angry, hurt, or resentful way

definitions: to an extreme, forceful, or particularly harsh degree

examples.text: he was bitterly opposed by the majority shareholder
its humor is cutting and bitterly sarcastic

shortDefinitions: to extreme, forceful, or particularly harsh degree

definitions: (relating to wind or weather) to an intensely cold degree
